paper_abstract: Gray codes, where two consecutive codewords differ in exactly one position by +/- 1, are given. In a single- radix code, all dimensions have the same base, say, k, whereas, in a mixed- radix code, the base in one dimension can be different from the base in another dimension. Constructions of new classes of mixed- radix Gray codes are presented. It is shown how these codes can be used as a basis for constructing edge- disjoint Hamiltonian cycles in mixed- radix toroidal networks when the number of dimensions n = 2r for some r >= 0. Efficient algorithms for the generation of these codes are then shown.
paper_title: Mixed-radix gray codes in lee metric
